| History                 = The Alternative was a minor [[New York]] newspaper, publisher by [[Neil Crawford (Earth-616)|Neil Crawford]].

It was known for his '''Mutant Diaries''', chronicles of [[Homo superior|mutants]] everyday-life collected by [[Sally Floyd (Earth-616)|Sally Floyd]]. 

===[[Decimation]] : Ex-Mutant Diaries===
In the wake of the [[M-Day]], Sally started work around the depowered mutants, starting the '''Ex-Mutants Diaries''', and both Sally and her interviewed were targeted by a mutant killer, the [[Ghoul (Killer) (Earth-616)|Ghoul]] who was eventually defeated and seemingly killed by the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]].{{r|Generation M Vol 1 #1|#5}}

===Civil War===
During the Superhuman Civil War around the [[Superhuman Registration Act]], Sally Floyd interviewed the [[Anti-Registration Underground (Earth-616)|Anti-Registration Underground]] and was approached by different protagonists, leading the [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] agent [[Eric Marshall (Earth-616)|Eric Marshall]] to arrest both Floyd and the publisher [[Neil Crawford (Earth-616)|Neil Crawford]].{{r|Civil War: Front Line Vol 1 5}}

In the end of the Civil War, Sally quit the Alternative and associated with her colleague [[Benjamin Urich (Earth-616)|Ben Urich]], himself quitting the [[Daily Bugle (The DB!) (Earth-616)|Daily Bugle]].{{r|Civil War: Front Line Vol 1 11}}

===Closure profiting to the Front Line===
As the Front Line was declining quickly after his launch (Sally starting back to drink and Ben thinking about came back to the Daily Bugle), a mysterious benefactor, who was later revealed to be [[John Jonah Jameson (Earth-616)|J.J. Jameson]], bought the Alternative and his locals and offered it to Urich, along with a massive salary for him and Sally Floyd, presenting himself as someone who wanted to annoy Jameson and to made Urich make real journalism.

The Front Line then settle in the Alternative newsroom with an extended staff.{{r|World War Hulk: Front Line Vol 1 1}}

It is unknown if the Alternative was already closed when it was bought out, if the Front Line was rebuilt on the status of the Alternative and if other Alternative staff joined the Front Line.

The newsroom was later used by the new [[Daily Bugle (Front Line) (Earth-616)|Daily Bugle]] (truly the Front Line renamed), after the [[Daily Bugle (The DB!) (Earth-616)|Daily Bugle]] (as this time the "DB!") was shut down and the [[Daily Bugle Building]] destroyed by [[Maxwell Dillon (Earth-616)|Electro]].
